CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 26, 1953, pg. 2, reads: "107th Birthday - Mrs. Sabra Washington, who was born a slave, and who celebrated her 107th birthday here Sunday with her neighbors in her home at 8141 Conemaugh Street... - Harris Photo."Cutline of image published after the fact in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 22, 1958, pg. 1, reads: "Pittsburgh's Oldest Woman Succumbs - Mrs. Sabre Washington, known as "Mother" to her many friends, died at the age of 113 last Friday. The ex-slave was born on a plantation near Nicholson, S. C., but had lived in Pittsburgh for many years.  The above pictures were taken before she was taken to the John J. Kane Hospital a few months ago where she died. in first picture, taken after her 110th birthday, Mrs. Washington revealed she still had good eyesight as she gazed into a mirror while brushing her hair... - Harris photos."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of former slave Sabre "Mother" Washington, brushing her hair and seated in floral chair, on her 107th birthday, in her home on Conemaugh Street
